name: The Forest Knight (Druid 28 / CoT 10 / Rogue 2) and Eternal Corrupted Guardian (Druid 28 / Fighter 10 / Assassin 2)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This was a build idea trying to combine the fantastic disables of the druid class with some solid hitting power.

The Forest Knight
Went halfling to be able to wield a scimitar in two hands and thwack things
CoT/Rogue for some combat feats and great synergy between evasion / saves and of course to dump skill points into Tumble and UMD
Druid buffs should push both Str and Wis sky high, easily capping it
Constitution can also be buffed too.
Shapeshifting is probably not useful in this build, which may be a good thing, given one can't cast spells whilst polymorphed, which I always found annoying.
Zen Archery for some ranged damage too with bonuses from halfling size and thrown weapons (ie darts / throwing axes / slings). With Owl's Insight, its an easy +6 to ranged AB
Base melee AB 40, base ranged AB 35 (I think this is thrown weapon)
Comments appreciated, I never made anything like this before

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Yes, it's basically a spell blade using Druid instead of arcana.  A Forest Blade.  I take it your focus on Conjuration is to get some use out of SoV and Stonehold, and to some extend Vine Mines and the like?  

He gets pretty solid AB for all those Druid levels.  Prem and Stoneskins should see you through the mobs.  I'm curious if taking Monk instead of Rogue would allow for almost a tangent spinoff character in which you throw away your plate and go tunic and jerkin and let Wisdom be your guide.  It would also net you an extra feat (dropping Heavy Armor). The obvious loss is UMD.  It really feels like a different character at that point, and it's merely a change of two levels.  Interesting....

Druids are surprisingly easy to level up pre-epics, and I don't think this guy would be an exception.  The trouble, at least for me, was Druids in Epics.  That's not fault of your build, but a fault in the class in general.

Thanks for sharing, Orion.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for your message and reading my build GDL. This is kind of an experimental build I've never tried before, and it arose mostly from my frustrations playing the Druid class.

Druids are really powerful but have less spell casts per day than their cleric comrades probably because Druids get polymorphs and an animal companion to compensate. The disables are simply fabulous.

One of the troubles was polymorphing all the time got tedious and one can't cast spells while polymorphed and there are limits on the number of morphs / day except at High levels where the polymorphs fall off and struggle to hit things when I attempted a run through Rarys fortress. It was pretty much Dragon Shape spam most of the way, which with only 3 casts / day meant I was casting through those Leomunds much more than some of my other builds. Sometimes I could hit things in water elemental form but my opponents would have to have a grease spell and lying on the floor for me to hit em

I wanted to create something that can take advantage of the SoV/Stonehold/Grease/Entangle combo whilst giving them a solid Thwacking. There's a couple of no DC spells like Harm and Creeping Doom which are pretty sweet. Harm benefits from high AB being a touch attack. Anyway I'm curious as to what this build might look like with Devastating Critical which I might look into when I finish up at work today. Also would be good to look at the DCs for Grease Stonehold and SoV for the build when buffed with Owls Insight.

Oh yes I went Rogue over Monk. I wanted to be clad in some solid armor and shield and scimitar whilst hitting plus UMD as you stated, is just such a powerful ability.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Redid the build
Put in dev crit
Went Druid / Fighter / Assassin to incorporate dev crit without sacrificing AB
Still is undispellable but this comes late
Went human for the extra feat and skill points. Did max discipline because quite a few players want to have that skill at least for some knockdown/disarm/called shot resistance, but it could be dropped for extra disable trap / craft trap / heal / lore. Listen could also be dumped for those skills as Druid has a True Sight spell but in the environment I play in True Sight is nerfed. I chose to go Craft Trap 11 modified as Druid has a spell called One with the Land which increases set trap by 4, allowing the player to set deadly traps with that spell active 
Halfling would have been nice but the -2 str plus the wisdom requirements for accessing spells would have meant either level 9 druid spells or devastating critical would come quite late in the build which I didn't like.

update: Redid the build as I found this portrait, I couldn't make a character with this portrait an evil alignment

Just gonna wear the exp penalties I think, or take rogue late 
It has a lot more skill points as a result of not cross classing 18 points to get assassin + a few extra from rogue
Exp penalties from 22 onwards

Update: Have playtested this one to level 5 on WoG, made some slight adjustments to the leveling. On WoG this build is very strong early with all the druid goodness plus animal companion plus empowered summons. The AB bonus outdoors is very strong. At level 2 I was running around outdoors with +7 AB (BAB 1 +1WF +3str +2outdoors) with a mundane greatsword :)
